title: Potting up Tomato Seedlings! ALL 540 of Them!

subtasks: Ensure potting soil is moist before transplanting
Fill 72-cell trays with moist potting soil
Gently remove seedlings from 128-cell trays by pinching the base and untangling roots
Plant seedlings in 72-cell trays, burying up to the first set of true leaves
Water transplanted seedlings thoroughly to avoid transplant shock
Monitor and adjust watering to prevent corners from drying out
Label and separate different tomato varieties in the 72-cell trays
Pot up other seedling varieties following similar steps
Provide tips for hardening off and transplanting tomatoes outdoors
Maintain proper soil moisture and avoid fertilizing immediately after transplanting

tasks.task: Teaching how to handle and pot up tomato seedlings
subtasks: Explain the difference between seed leaves (cotyledons) and true leaves
Demonstrate how to properly pinch and remove seedlings from the original tray
Show technique for planting seedlings into new cells, ensuring roots are covered
Discuss importance of proper stem burial and root establishment
Emphasize the need for thorough watering after transplanting and subsequent monitoring
Address common challenges such as drying out in the center cells and adjusting water management
Advise on timing for fertilizing transplanted seedlings
Recommend hardening off period for outdoor planting
Suggest proceeding with planting when there's no risk of frost
Refer viewers to previous hardening off video for further information
Encourage viewers to join Facebook group for questions and support
Promote engagement through likes, comments, and subscriptions
Encourage viewers to leave questions in comments or on Facebook
Commit to answering viewer questions in a timely manner via Facebook and email (虽然是否有通过电子邮件回复的问题未明确提及)
Highlight the advantages of using Facebook for communication over email
Invite viewers to suggest future gardening video topics
